result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devenier L Senter

defendant.name: Senter, Devenier L
defendant.address: 6009 North Apple Blossom Lane, Glendale, WI 53217

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Devenier L Senter in court.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Devenier L Senter.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defense was recently appointed, received discovery and no offer. State will give defense an offer. Case is adjourned for plea/sentencing. Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Devenier L Senter in court.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court appoints Michael Plaisted as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Plaisted accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $100.00 every two weeks, commencing 12/01/2022 until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 30th, 2022

Defendant Devenier L Senter in court.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defendant does not have counsel. Court adjourned case to allow time for defendant to retain counsel.
Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Oral No Contact Order with SRW.

Defendant Devenier L Senter in court.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to  Reserve Judge, Branch 13. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 13.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/11/2022@2:30pm
